sn55.5:1.1: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
sn55.5:1.2: “Sāriputta, they speak of a ‘factor of stream-entry’.
sn55.5:1.3: What is a factor of stream-entry?”
sn55.5:1.4: “Sir, the factors of stream-entry are associating with true persons, listening to the true teaching, rational application of mind, and practicing in line with the teaching.”
sn55.5:1.6: For the factors of stream-entry are associating with true persons, listening to the true teaching, rational application of mind, and practicing in line with the teaching.
sn55.5:2.3: “Sir, the stream is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn55.5:2.4: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.”
sn55.5:2.6: For the stream is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn55.5:2.7: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn55.5:3.3: “Sir, anyone who possesses this noble eightfold path is called a stream-enterer, the venerable of such and such name and clan.”
sn55.5:3.5: For anyone who possesses this noble eightfold path is called a stream-enterer, the venerable of such and such name and clan.”
